entry.title: New Blog Of Interest
entry.content:
An interesting new blog is out there about physics-based animation. You can go and read it here.

It is mainly from a gaming perspective but I think that most of the theory can be applied to engineering as well. A lot of great theory comes out of the gaming arena and they certainly share ideas a lot more than the engineering arena.

Comments

Garry Bodsworth
I think that part of the theory coming from this is that it is thought about from a practical real-world use standpoint. It is always possible to come up with the ideal solution but I would say it very rarely works in the real world without an extremely small problem domain.
Brigadeer Ridikulos
Well, to be fair it's really coming more from an academic computer graphics and film/visual effects standpoint, since a lot of the stuff there isn't really fast enough to be incorporated into real-time games (though might be soon, with GPU's going the way they are). But I definitely agree with your point about theory coming out of the graphics world; there's a lot of smart people in graphics these days, and I think it's more and more plausible that some of what gets developed will feed back into the computational mechanics and fluid dynamics communities.
